question.text:
Given below are four statements (A-D) each with two blanks. Select the option which correctly fills up the blanks in two statements.
i.  1100-1200
ii. 1/5th

options.text: During a cardiac cycle each ventricle pumps out approximately ___i___ of blood which is called as the ___ii___.
The first heart sound (lub) is associated with the closure of the ___i___ valves whereas, the second heart sound (dub) is associated with the closure of the ___ii___ valves.
On an average ___i___ ml of blood is filtered by the kidneys per minute which constitute roughly ___ii___ of the blood pumped out by each ventricle of the heart in a minute.
A comparison of the volume of the filtrate formed per day ___i___ litres with that of the urine released suggests that nearly ___ii___ of the filtrate has to be reabsorbed by the renal tubules.

solution.text: On an average, 1100-1200 ml of blood is filtered by the kidneys per minute which constitute roughly 1/5<sup>th</sup> of the blood pumped out by each ventricle of the heart in a minute.
